learning_outcomes.description: Apply key concepts of biology and genetics (reproduction system, Mendelian, population and quantitative genetics) in plant improvement.
Analysis and interpret data from plant breeding using appropriate tools and techniques.
Evaluate breeding objectives and selection methods for different crop types and reproduction systems.
Communicate plant breeding concepts effectively through visual and oral formats for academic and professional audiences.

assessments.due_date:
30/03/2026 5:00 pm

This assessment is completed and submitted in class during the timetabled practical session.
assessments.task_description:
Please refer to the course schedule on Blackboard for the test date. It will be conducted during a practical timeslot.

The test will be closed-book, consisting of multiple-choice and/or short-answer questions, administered In-class through Blackboard.

Students will need to bring their own (fully charged) devices. Students are responsible for ensuring a stable internet connection while undertaking an online test/quiz.

Troubleshooting – if students experience any technical difficulties during the online test/quiz:

  • Do not close the browser window.
  • Contact ‘Ask Us’ immediately support.my.uq.edu.au/app/chat/chat_launch_lib – if the technical issue cannot be resolved, ask for a copy of the chat.
  • Document the problem – if you receive an error message or similar, take a copy of the message, note the time/date of the problem, which web browser you used, exactly what you were doing at the time and any other relevant information.
  • Email your course coordinator (copy in AGFS Admin – agriculture@enquire.uq.edu.au) with your documented evidence and a copy of the AskUs chat.  Any delays in this communication being received may impact on the advice that could be provided to you.

This assessment task is to be completed in person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempt to use AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment is completed and submitted within Blackboard under the appropriate assessment title on your course Blackboard Ultra site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
You will be required to analyse and report the results of data analysis as a poster presentation.

Further information and details will be on the course BlackBoard Ultra site.

AI-Permitted Use: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a range of emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI in completing this assessment task, provided that the use of AI is reported as outlined for each assessment task.

assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
25/05/2026 5:00 pm

29/05/2026 2:00 pm

The presentation will be held during the scheduled lecture and practical class in Week 13.

Slides and reflection are due on Friday of Week 13 at 2 pm.
assessments.task_description:
This assessment offers a collaborative opportunity to articulate, evaluate, and refine your plant breeding design through peer discussion, feedback, and critical reflection. This assessment has two parts:

Part 1: Presentation (10 minutes). Share and discuss the results of your breeding simulation design with peers, receive formative feedback, and engage in reflective discussion. This session will be held during the scheduled lecture and tutorial in Week 13.

Part 2: Reflection (200 - 500 words). Reflect on your presentation, summarise peer feedback, identify improvements and update your slides based on the feedback and consider what you’ve learned from others’ presentations. The reflection and slides are due after the presentation (Week 13, Friday at 2 pm).

AI-Permitted Use: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a range of emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI to complete this assessment task, provided they report its use as outlined for each assessment task.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Part 1: The Showcase Presentation during scheduled class time. Refer to the grading rubric on the course BlackBoard Ultra site for assessment criteria.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 12(23 Feb - 24 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Lecture Series

The content of lectures delivered throughout the semester. Further information will be provided on Blackboard. Please note the lecture schedule is subject to change, and updates will be provided through Blackboard.


Sub-activity: Week 1 - Introduction to Plant Breeding Week 2 - Plant Domestication/Genetic Res, Reproductive systems, Mendelian Genetics Week 3 - Breeding self pollinating crops, Introduction to population and quantitative genetics Week 4 - Breeding program optimization (breeders equation), molecular breeding Week 5 - Breeding cross pollinated crops -hybrid crops Week 6 - Breeding hybrid crops with CMS Week 7 - High through put phenotyping Week 9 - Breeding horticultural crops -Macadamia, Apple, Selection Indices Week 10 - Breeding horticultural crops -Eucalyptus, Strawberry, Almond Week 11 - Elite Plant Breeding/ novel breeding techniques Week 12 - Breeding for climate change, Speed breeding

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
